explanation: The report is correct. MHD_lookup_connection_value simply returns pos->value (calling through to MHD_lookup_connection_value_n) and MHD_lookup_connection_value_n supplies the pointer and separately supplies pos->value_size; it does not guarantee the value buffer is NUL-terminated. The call strstr(con_header, "Upgrade") requires a NUL-terminated C string and will scan until it finds a terminating NUL; if the header buffer is not NUL-terminated and the substring is not found within the valid bytes, strstr can read past the end of the object — an out‑of‑bounds access. That is exactly what MISRA C 2023 Rule 21.17 forbids. Recommended fixes include obtaining the value size via MHD_lookup_connection_value_n and performing a bounded search (e.g. memmem-like search over the known length or a safe manual search), or ensuring the library always provides NUL-terminated strings before calling strstr.
